name: Lago Negro
excerpt: About 1.5km southwest of the center, Lago Negro is an attractive artificial lake surrounded by hydrangeas and crowded with swan boats.
detail_description: About 1.5km southwest of the center, Lago Negro is an attractive artificial lake surrounded by hydrangeas and crowded with swan boats.

name: Igreja do Relógio
excerpt: This Lutheran church is one of Gramado's most famous landmarks.
detail_description:
This Lutheran church is one of Gramado's most famous landmarks.
Inaugurated in 1953, it features a bell forged in Germany in 1826.

name: Igreja Matriz São Pedro
excerpt: Gramado's stone church on the main square is a favorite photo point with Brazilians.
detail_description:
Gramado's stone church on the main square is a favorite photo point with Brazilians.
It was built with 78,000 basalt stones pulled by bull carts from nearby quarries and features stained-glass windows marking the life of Peter, based on designs by German artist Peter Dobmeier. There are also 12 life-size statues of the apostles in front of the church. A wooden version of the church was originally consecrated in 1917; it was changed to stone in 1943 after eights years of construction.
